tasks.title: Implement test summary output for unit.h framework
tasks.description:
Add final summary report to unit.h testing framework:
- Track total tests run (passed + failed)
- Display summary after all tests complete
- Show failed test names with error locations
- Optional: execution time tracking

Follow the design specified in docs/UNIT_H_GOALS.md:49-71.

Example output format:
========================================
Test Summary
========================================
Total:  42 tests
Passed: 40 tests
Failed:  2 tests

Failed tests:
  - test_name: expectNear failed at file.cpp:123

Execution time: 0.342s (optional)
========================================
tasks.notes:
Currently UNIT_H_GOALS.md marks this as "🚧 Planned" (line 49). Implementation should:
- Add test counter to TestRegistry
- Create printSummary() method
- Call from TestRegistry::result() or provide separate summary() function
- Maintain backward compatibility (return code still uses total_failures_)
acceptance: TestRegistry tracks total tests run (not just failures)
Summary printed at end of test execution (before returning from main)
Summary includes: total/passed/failed counts
Failed tests listed with names and first failure location
Uses std::print for consistent formatting (per CLAUDE.md)
Summary only shown if tests were run (not for empty test binaries)
Unit tests verify summary output (check stdout)
Optional: Add UNIT_SHOW_TIMING env var for execution time

tasks.title: Add CMake export/install targets for packaging
tasks.description:
Make tempura installable and usable via find_package():
- Add install(TARGETS ...) commands for all libraries
- Create tempuraConfig.cmake.in for find_package support
- Set up proper INSTALL_INTERFACE paths in target_include_directories
- Add version configuration (tempuraConfigVersion.cmake)
- Create installation instructions in docs/INSTALLATION.md
- Test external project can use find_package(tempura COMPONENTS symbolic3 bayes)
tasks.notes: This is a nice-to-have feature for making tempura usable as an external dependency. Low priority since this is a research project.
